alert.note: Alert for Southeastern Brooks Range; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Upper Koyukuk Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 29 at 6:36AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...The Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys and Upper Koyukuk Valley from Bettles west. * WHEN...Through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff from heavy rain may result in flooding of streams and rivers and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. At this time, flooding of the mainstem of the Koyukuk, Noatak and Kobuk Rivers is not expected, but those rivers will see sharp rises this week with water overbank in some low lying locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - The 2 to 4 inches of rain that fell the past 5 days over the Koyukuk Basin from the Dalton Highway West, and over the Kobuk and Upper Noatak Basins, has now worked its way downstream through tributaries and is working its way into the mainstream of these rivers. Another half inch of rain is expected over this area through Wednesday night. Expect streams and small rivers to remain high today, while the mainstem of these rivers rise over the next several days and may reach near bankfull. More heavy rain coming late this week with the remains of Tropical Storm Damrey could cause further high water this weekend. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Southeastern Brooks Range; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Upper Koyukuk Valley
